results.title: Build a better bag lunch
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: Shows in a humurous and playful way that packed lunches can vary in content and style every day, and that the packed lunch can help control one’s salt, sugar and fat intake. Suggests many combinations of fillings from the main food groups, and shows the important role of vacuum containers. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Buffet Froid = Cold Cuts
results.creator_credit: WDR La Sept Cinema and Bertrand Blier
results.brief_description:
Alphonse Tram discovers his penknife planted in the belly of a moribund accountant lying in a subway corridor. He tries to engage in a conversation with the moribund who rebuffs him. Lost and angry, Alphonse goes back home, in the modern tower where he lives with his wife. She introduces him to their new neighbour, a police inspector. Later Alphonse’s wife is found murdered and her hapless murderer almost immediately confesses to Alphonse, but neither the husband, nor the police inspector seem to be shocked. The three sit down to enjoy a friendly drink when a man arrives and accuses Alphonse of the subway murder. ‘Buffet Froid’ is a wonderfully absurd black comedy that cunningly reverses the conventions of the crime thriller to comment on the alienating and dehumanizing effects of contemporary urban life.

Credits: Producer, Alain Sarde ; director, Bertrand Blier ; writer, Bertrand Blier ; photography, Jean Penzer ; music, Philippe Sarde, Johannes Brahms ; art direction, Theobald Meurisse.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Bernard Blier, Jean Carmet, Genevieve Page, Michel Serrault, Carole Bouquet, Jean Rougerie, Bernard Crombey, Denise Gence, Jean Benguigui, Liliane Rovere.

results.title: Buffaloes for ploughing
results.brief_description: The role of the water-buffalo in improving rice production in Malaya. Shows how a buffalo calf is trained as a farm animal. Its nostrils are pierced at six months and a ring inserted so that it can be led. At two years training is commenced, the buffalo learns how to pull, how to obey signals from his master and finally how to plough. Only patience and practice are needed to produce a thoroughly useful farm buffalo.

results.title: Budjerri Dyillagami: Peggeralin
results.brief_description: A video artwork by Ngarigo artist Peter Waples-Crowe in collaboration with Glynn Urquhart.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: A video artwork by Ngarigo artist Peter Waples-Crowe in collaboration with Glynn Urquhart.

results.title: Budgeting your money
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
This film shows four young people in different financial situations discussing their budgeting problems in conversations which lead to information on how budgets are made and carried out. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Budget cuts
results.brief_description: Produced by Oxo, in association with the National Federation of Meat Traders Association, this is a demonstration of cooking, and the attractive arrangement of low-cost dishes. A butcher explains and shows various cuts of meat; emphasizes the value of cheaper cuts and how they can be used to advantage. No other credits available.

results.title: Buddhism in China
results.brief_description: The rise of Buddhism in China is traced from its beginning in 4 BC. The film gives a good outline of Buddha’s philosophy and teaching, the further changes and the new sects. The film is narrated by Alexander Scourby.

results.title: Buckstop
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Rhian Hinkley
results.brief_description: Five minutes of animation through the use of 3,000 still photographs serves as a homage to the spaghetti Western, as Buck rides into town looking for a bit of action and a parking space.

results.title: Bucklesbury farm
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, BBC-TV and George Inger
results.brief_description: This film shows a Britsol school six weeks after the beginning of term. An experienced teacher, new to the school, is shown introducing practical science and mathematics along lines recommended by Science 5/13: a project jointly sponsored by the Schools Council and the Nuffield Foundation. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: Bubu Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film with an imaginative use of sound. Conveys the impression of a vast shadowy world of offices and vague ghostly people who provide the forms which require your signature. Kafka-esque, impressionistic and likely to puzzle most audiences.
